choices.C: It shows COST_REMARK for all the promos in the promo category 'TV'

discussion.content: Could an explanation be provided for this question please?

choices.A: It gives an error because the having clause should be specified after the group by clause.
choices.B: It gives an error because all the aggregate functions used in the having clause must be specified in the select list.
choices.C: It displays the item nos with their average quantity where the average quantity is more than double the minimum quantity of that item in the table.
choices.D: It displays the item nos with their average quantity where the average quantity is more than double the overall minimum quantity of all the items in the table.

discussion.content: Can having clause come before group by? A should be the answer
Can having clause come before group by? B should be the answer

questions.answer_description:
A: the WHERE clause 1=2 is false so no rows will be inserted into the new table.
D: The NOT NULL constraints will be included in the new table. There are no UNIQUE constraints.

choices.E: The SALES1 table would not be created because column-specified names in the select and create table clauses do not match,
choices.A: The SALES1 table is created with no rows but only a structure.
choices.D: The SALES1 table would have not null and unique constraints on the specified columns.
choices.C: The SALES1 table would not be created because of the invalid where clause.
choices.B: The SALES1 table would have primary key and unique constraints on the specified columns.

discussion.content:
D is correct. tested it below

select hire_date, 
trim(to_char(hire_date, 'fmDay')) || ', '||
trim(to_char(hire_date, 'fmMonth')) ||' '||
trim(to_char(hire_date, 'fmDD, YYYY'))
from employees
i think D is wrong, fm removes 0 before day. (Friday, January 01, 1999 would be Friday, January 1, 1999). Could someone check and provide with correct answer?
